bug.summary: EarlyStoppingCallback considers first epoch as bad
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug Report</denchmark-h>
EarlyStoppingCallback considers first epoch as bad. This can lead for example to always stopping after first epoch if patience=1. <denchmark-h:h3>How To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
You can train a model with early stopping and patience=1 and see that it always stops after first epoch. Or you can use the unit test below that I added to pull request. <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
from unittest.mock import MagicMock, PropertyMock
from catalyst.core import EarlyStoppingCallback
def test_patience1(): """@TODO: Docs. Contribution is welcome.""" early_stop = EarlyStoppingCallback(1) runner = MagicMock() type(runner).stage_name = PropertyMock(return_value="training") type(runner).valid_metrics = PropertyMock(return_value={"loss": 0.001}) stop_mock = PropertyMock(return_value=False) type(runner).need_early_stop = stop_mock
early_stop.on_epoch_end(runner)
assert stop_mock.mock_calls == [] <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Training doesn't stop after first epoch. And the unit test passes. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
